page.title: 04Tidbury Green School
page.content: Tidbury Green School was opened in 1931 with just two classrooms,a third was added in 1937.At this time water had to be carried from a water pump which was in the centre of the field.The"Canteen" (now school hall) was added in 1949.The school was originally heated by black coal boilers in every room.In 1981 to 1982 the school was threatened with closure by the Education Committee because of "falling numbers". The parents fought strongly supported by the governors to "save their school". They won and today numbers are increasing due partly to 1981 Education Act,which allows children from "over the county border" of Hereford and Worcestshire to attend.This summer a new temporary classroom is to be added due to the financial support given by the parents to fund raising events.
